CHAPTER.VERS: A Genealogical Record of Jesus Christ, Descendent of David and of Abraham:
Abraham had Isaac, Isaac had Jacob,Jacob had Judah and his brothers,
Judah had Fares and Zara from Tamar, Fares had Hesrom,Hesrom had Aram,
Aram had Aminadab Aminadab had Naasson,Naason had Salmon,
Salmon & Rahab had Boaz, Boaz & Ruth had Obed,Obed had Jesse,
Jesse had King David, David got with Urriah’s wife and had Solomon,
Solomon had Rehoboam, Rehoboam had Abia,Abia had Asaf,
Asaf had Jehosaphat, Jehosaphat had Jeoram,Jeoram had Ozias,
Ozias had Jotham, Jotham had Ahab,Ahab had Hezekiah,
Hezekiah had Manassah, Manassah had Amos,Amos had Josiah,
Josiah had Jehonias and his brothers while in captivity in Babylon,
After the Babylonian captivity, Jehonias had Salathial, Salathial had Zerubabel,
Zerubabel had Abioud, Abiod had Eliakim,Eliakim had Azor,
Azor had Zadok, Zadok had Achim,Achim had Eliud,
Eliud had Eleazar, Eleazar had Matthan,Matthan had Jacob,
Jacob had Joseph, Mary’s husband, …and from her was born Jesus, who’s called “the Christ.”

In total, there were fourteen generations from Abraham to David; there were fourteen generations from David to the Babylonian captivity; there were fourteen generations from the Babylonian captivity to Jesus.

The Way Jesus’s Birth Was After Mary was engaged but before she was officially married to Joseph—and before she was intimate with him—she found that she was pregnant, and that it was from the Holy Spirit.
Her husband Joseph, being someone who always did the right thing and not wanting to disgrace Mary, decided to himself that he’d quietly break up with her.

After he talked himself into doing this—of all things—an angel sent from the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said,“Joseph, you marvelous godsend, don’t be afraid to keep Mary as your wife; what she’s conceived in fact came from the Holy Spirit.
She’ll give birth to a son, and you’re going to name him ‘Jesus’, since he will indeed deliver the people from their sins.”
All of this has happened in order to fulfill the prophecy which came through the Prophet Isaiah, which says,
Check this out! Our virgin here will get pregnant and give birth to a son, And they’ll call him Emmanuel (which translated means “God with us”)
Joseph woke up from the dream and did just as he was told to do by the angel sent from God and kept Mary as his wife
and didn’t sleep with her until after she’d given birth to the son, whom he named Jesus.
Now after Jesus was born in Bethlehem, in the province of Judea, during the days of King Herod, out of nowhere these gurus called “magii” who came from the East and showed up in Jerusalem
going about saying, “Where’s that child-king of the Jews? The fact is, we saw his star while over in the East and came to worship him.”
Hearing about this made King Herod queasy, along with everyone else in Jerusalem.
So he gathered the chief priests and the designated teachers called scribes and quizzed them to find out exactly where the Messiah would be born.
They told him, “In Bethlehem, Judea, since it’s been written about by the Prophet Micah:
”And for you, Bethlehem, Judea, by no means Do you come in last placeIn the Judean power rankings;For out of you will come a ruler who’ll lead my people Israel”
Then Herod stealthily summoned the magii and ascertained from them the time of the star’s appearance,
and sent them to Bethlehem telling them, “Go ask around and gather all the facts you can about this child. Then after you find him, come tell me so that I can come and worship him too.”

Having heard this from the king, they went out and—just like that—the same star which they saw back east took the lead in front of them until it reached the place where the child was and then stood still up over that place.
Seeing what the star had done, they got really excited.

They went into the house and saw the child with his mother Mary and fell flat on their faces and worshipped him. Then they opened their chests and delivered gifts to him, gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
And having received a divine instruction given through a dream to not return to Herod but instead to take another way out, they left to go back to their homeland.

Now after they had departed, just like that an angel appeared in a dream to Joseph telling him, “Get up, grab the child and his mother, and run for your life to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you. Herod, you see, is going about seeking to eliminate the child.”
So he got up, took the child and his mother, and left for Egypt under the cover of darkness.
And he stayed there until Herod passed away, in order that the prophet Hosea’s prophecy would be fulfilled, which says, “From out of Egypt I summoned my son.”

Now when Herod realized that he’d been tricked by the magii, he got really angry and had all the children in Bethlehem and all the surrounding areas eliminated, from two and under, consistent with the time which he’d ascertained from the magii.
It was then that the prophet Jeremiah’s prophecy was fulfilled, which says,
A sound was heard in Ramah— Weeping and wailing—Rachel crying over her childrenAnd she wasn’t wanting to be comforted,Since they’re gone for good
After Herod died—just like that—an angel sent from the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph while in Egypt
saying, “Get up and take the child and his mother and go to Israel, now that those who’ve been craving to snuff out the child’s life are finally dead.”
So he got up and took the child and his mother and entered the country of Israel.
But since he heard that Archelaos had replaced his father as king of Judea, he was afraid to go over there. Getting instructions through a dream, he detoured over to the Galilean area,
and when he got there, he settled in a city called Nazareth, in order that what the prophets had prophesied would be fulfilled, that he would be considered to be a Nazarene.
Now back in those days, John the Baptist appeared on the scene in the Judean countryside
saying, “Straighten up and change your ways, since God’s involvement with mankind (the kingdom of heaven) just got here!
You see, what’s taking place here is the prophecy from Isaiah which says, The sound of shouting in the countryside:“Block off the road the Lord will take!Barricade the streets he’ll be on!”
John dressed himself in a camel-hair outfit wrapped in a leather belt, and his diet consisted of grasshoppers and wild honey.
At that time everybody in Jerusalem and Judea and everybody from around the Jordan kept coming out to see him.
And they were one after another being baptized in the Jordan River by him while pouring their hearts out in confessing their sins out loud.
Seeing that many of the Pharisees and Sadducees were showing up at his baptism, he said to them, “You nest of vipers, who convinced you to run for your lives because of the coming wrath?
Have the change in lifestyle which goes hand-in-hand with the commitment to a change in ways.
And while discussing this among yourselves, don’t say, ‘We’re descendants of Abraham.’ Oh yes—I tell you, God is able to turn these stones here into descendants of Abraham.
The axe is lying next to the tree trunk and is ready to be used: Every tree which isn’t yielding good fruit will be chopped down and tossed into a fire.
with the winnowing fork in his hand, he’ll clear everything off his threshing floor too. He’ll store his wheat in the silo but will burn up the chaff with a fire that will never be put out.”
Then Jesus appeared on the scene in the Jordan region, coming from Galilee, to get with John, to be baptized by him.
But John brushed him off saying, “It’s me who needs to be baptized by you, but you’re approaching me instead?”
Jesus formulated a reply and said, He then permitted it.
While he was being baptized, he came straight up out of the water, and—of all things—the sky opened up, and he saw the Spirit of God coming down like a dove upon him.
And—of all things—a voice spoke from the sky saying, “This one here is my Beloved Son, and I’m quite pleased with him.”
Then Jesus was guided by the Spirit into the countryside to be tempted by the devil.
After fasting for forty days and nights, he finally became hungry,
and the Tempter came by and said, “If your position is indeed Son of God, speak so that these stones become bread.”
But he answered him,
So the devil then took him to the holy city, and placed him on the battlements on the temple roof.

He turned and, in continuation, said, “If you’re indeed God’s son, jump off. I mean, it’s written,Where you are concerned,He’ll issue orders for His angels to follow.They’ll even lift you up by putting you on their hands,Lest your foot impact a stone.”
Jesus declared to him,
So again the devil took him to a really high mountain and shows him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
And he said, “All of these I’ll give to you, if you would fall and worship me.”
Then Jesus, finishing the conversation, said,
Then the devil left him, and—then and there—some angels came and attended to him.
Once he heard that John had been taken into custody, he withdrew to Galilee.
After leaving Nazareth for good, he took up residence in Capernaum-on-the-Sea in the region of Zebulon and Naphtali,
so that Isaiah’s prophecy might be fulfilled, which says,
In the land of Zebulon and in the land of Naphtali On the road leading to the sea, on the other side of the JordanIn the region of Galilee—
The folk sitting in darkness saw a great light, And for the ones sitting in a region Where they were under the shadow of deathA light shined on them
Starting then, Jesus began to go about and proclaim openly,
While sauntering down the Sea of Galilee coastline, he saw two brothers, Simon, whom they call Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting fishing nets into the sea, since they were fishermen.
He said to them,
Right away they quit being fishermen and became his disciples.
Continuing on from there, he saw another pair of brothers, James son of Zebedee and John his brother, in the boat with their father Zebedee mending their fishing nets. He called them.
Right away they left the boat and their father and became his disciples.

He began to go about the entire region of Galilee teaching in the synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and treatingany kind of and all sorts of diseases and any kind of and all sorts of maladies among the people.

News of him spread throughout the whole region of Syria. They brought to him all kinds of people having something wrong with them…various kinds of sicknesses, those suffering or in pain, the demon-possessed, epileptics, paralytics…and he treated everyone.
Large crowds from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, the Jordan, and from the other side of the Jordan followed him around.
Now seeing the crowds, he hiked up the mountains, and upon seating himself, his disciples came to him.
He opened his mouth and proceeded to teach them in a long, cohesive sermon:
After Jesus finished this sermon, the crowds were just amazed at the way he had taught:
For he taught in a captivating manner and not like their designated teachers.
After he came down out of the mountain, large crowds followed him.
Out of nowhere, a leper came up to him and started groveling in front of him, “Sir, if you so desire, you can clear me up.”

He stretched out his hand and touched him saying,
Immediately his leprosy cleared up.
Jesus then said to him,
After he entered Capernaum, an army captain came up to him pleading with him,
“Lord, my servant is bedfast, suffering terribly of paralysis.”
On top of the situation, Jesus said,
The captain then replied, “Lord, I’m not worthy for you to set foot in my house. Just give the word, and my servant will be healed.
You see, I’m a man who’s used to living under authority, having soldiers under my command. I say to this one ‘Come here!’ and he comes; I tell my servant ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”
Once he heard this, Jesus was just amazed, and said to his followers,
Jesus said to the captain,
Jesus entered Peter’s house and saw his mother-in-law bedfast with a high fever.
He touched her hand and the fever left her.
When evening arrived, they brought to him many demon-possessed, and he cast the spirits out with a few words, and he treated many who had something wrong with them,
in order that the Prophet Isaiah’s prophecy would be fulfilled, He himself took our weaknessesAnd bore our diseases
Now Jesus, seeing a crowd surrounding him, gave a command to hike up the mountain.
One of the designated teachers came and said to him, “Teacher, I’ll follow you wherever you happen to go.”
Jesus, following up the statement, said,
Another, who was one of his disciples, said, “Let me go from here and bury my father first.”
Jesus, following up that statement, said,
Then he got into a boat and his disciples followed him in.
And—like that—the sea broke into a great commotion, to the extent that the boat was overshadowed by waves. All the while, he was still asleep.
They came over and roused him from his sleep saying, “Lord—Help! We’re dying here!”

He said to them,
He then got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and a great calm came over the water.
The men were amazed and said, “Just what kind of guy is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

After he arrived on the other side, in the Gadarene region, he was accosted by two demon-possessed men coming out of the tombs—really dangerous men—so much so that no one was tough enough to pass through on that road.
Out of nowhere, they cried out, “We have no beef with you, Son of God—have you come here before the appointed time to torment us?”
Now off in the distance, a large herd of pigs was feeding.
The demons begged him, “If you’re going to cast us out, send us into the herd of pigs.”
He said to them, So they exited the men, went out and entered the pigs. Like that, the whole herd stampeded over the cliff and into the sea and died in the water.
All the herdsmen began to flee, and when they got to the city, they spread the word about everything that happened, including what happened to the demon-possessed men.
Then and there—the whole city came out to meet up with Jesus for the purpose of talking to him, and seeing him, they pleaded with him to leave the area.
He got into the boat, crossed over, and arrived at his hometown.
Momentarily, they brought him a paralytic laid up on a cot. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic,
Then and there, some of the designated teachers said among themselves, “This guy’s blaspheming.”
Reading their lips, Jesus said to them,
—He then turns and says to the paralytic,
So he got up and went back home.
Seeing this, a solemn reverence came over the crowd, and they glorified the God who gives authority such as this to mankind.
Now as Jesus continued on from there, he saw a man sitting at the customs table named Matthew and said, And he got up and followed him.
And when he happened to be lounging at the dinner table, out of nowhere several tax collectors and other kinds of sinners came and joined Jesus and his disciples at the table.
The Pharisees, seeing this, proceeded to say to his disciples, “Just why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and other kinds of sinners?”
He heard it and said
Then John’s disciples came to him, “Just why do we and the Pharisees fast all the time, but your disciples don’t fast?”
Jesus said,
While saying these things, out of nowhere a synagogue head came and began pleading with him saying, “My daughter just passed away—but now, if you come and lay your hand on her, she’ll live again.”
Jesus and his disciples got up and followed him.
And, quite abruptly, a woman who had a hemorrhage for twelve years came up behind him and touched the hem of his garment;
for she kept saying to herself, “If I could just touch his outer garment, I’ll get better.”
So Jesus turned, looked at her, and said, And the woman was delivered from her illness that moment.
After Jesus came to the synagogue head’s house and saw the flute players and the wailing crowd,
he went among those there saying,
When the crowd was thrown out, he went in and took hold of her hand, and the girl got up.
And his fame spread throughout the entire surrounding area.
Continuing on from there, two blind men followed Jesus, crying out, “Have pity on us, you wonderful godsend.”
Arriving at the house, the blind men approached him, and Jesus said to them, They then say to him, “Yes sir.”
Then he touched their eyes while saying,
and they regained their sight. Jesus firmly charged them, “Don’t let anyone know,”
but they left from there and talked all about it in the entire surrounding area.
While they were heading out, they brought to him a deaf, demon-possessed man.
After the demon had been cast out, the deaf man spoke. As the crowd was amazed, the rumor kept on being repeated, “This has never been seen before in Israel.”
But the Pharisees went around saying, “It’s by means of the head demon that he casts out demons.”
Jesus went about to all the cities and towns, teaching in the local synagogues and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom and healing all kinds of diseases and all kinds of infirmities.
Seeing the crowds, he felt deeply sorry for them because they were beaten down and defeated, like sheep that have no shepherd.
In line with this, he then said to his disciples,

…And summoning his twelve disciples, he gave them authority over filthy, disgusting spirits, so that they would cast them out and go about healing all sorts of sicknesses and all sorts of infirmities.
The names of the twelve missionaries are: first and foremost Simon, who’s called Peter, and his brother Andrew; James the son of Zebedee and his brother John;
Phillip and Bartholomew; Thomas and the tax collector Matthew; James the son of Alpheus; Thaddeus;
Simon the Cananaean(Cananaeans are also called “the Zealots”); and Judas Iscariot, the one who’ll betray him.
Jesus sent out these twelve telling them,
When Jesus had finished commissioning his twelve disciples, he went about from there teaching and proclaiming in the neighboring cities.
When John, who was in jail, heard about Jesus’s doings, he sent word to Jesus by way of some of his disciples,
asking, ”Are you the Coming One, or shall we wait for somebody else?”
While these disciples were on their way back to John, Jesus began to talk to the crowds about John,
He then began to rip on the cities that had had the most miracles, because they didn’t repent.
During that period of time, Jesus walked through the fields on Sabbath days. The disciples were hungry and began to go through and strip kernels off the wheat heads and eat them.
But the Pharisees, seeing what was happening, said to him, “See, look what your disciples are doing. This isn’t allowed on the Sabbath.”
And he said to them,
After he left from there, he went into one of the local synagogues.
There happened to be a man there with a shriveled-up hand, so they asked him, “Are we allowed to perform healings on the Sabbath?”, in order to find something to accuse him of.
He answered,
After Jesus made that known, he left from there. Many followed him, and he healed all of them.
He charged them to not let the word out about him,
so that Isaiah’s prophecy would be fulfilled,
Look! My chosen child, My beloved in whom My soul is pleased.I’ll put My Spirit upon himAnd announce justice to the nations.
He’ll neither squabble nor scream Nor will anyone hear his voice in the town square.
He won’t break a damaged twig, He won’t extinguish a wickUntil he brings about a victory for justice,
And those far off will have hope through him.
Then they brought to him a blind, mute, demon-possessed man, and he treated him, resulting in the mute man talking and seeing.
The entire crowd was amazed and was going about saying, ”Isn’t this fellow the marvelous godsend we’ve been waiting for all these years?”
But when the Pharisees heard about this, they said, “This guy can’t cast out demons except through the help of the demon chief Beelzebub.”
Knowing what they were really thinking, he said,
Then some of the designated teachers addressed him, and Pharisees too, “Teacher, we want you to perform a spectacular miracle.”
Jesus replied,
While he was in the middle of telling the crowds this, his mother and his brothers showed up standing outside wanting to have a word with him.
Someone told him, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside wanting to have a word with you.”
He answered the fellow who told him this,
He put his hand out on his disciples and said,
About that time, Jesus left his house and took a seat along the seashore.
A large crowd gathered around him, to the extent that he had to get in a boat and cast out a bit and sit there instead, while the crowd stood along the shoreline.
He used a lot of analogies when speaking. As an example he said,
His disciples approached him and said, “Why do you speak to them in analogies?”
He answered,

He told them another analogy:
Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd by way of parables, and he didn’t say anything apart from using a parable,
so that the Psalm would be fulfilled, I will open my mouth by means of analogy.I will pour out of itThat which has been hidden from the beginning of time.
Then he let the crowds go home. His disciples went up to him and asked, “Explain to us the parable of the field’s crab grass.”
He told them,
They then tell him, “yes.”

And when Jesus came to the end of speaking these parables, he left that place.

After he arrived at the place where his kinfolk lived, he taught them in the local synagogue, resulting in them being astonished and going about saying,“’Where’d this guy get this here wisdom and the miracles?
Isn’t this guy the craftsman’s son? Isn’t his mother the one called Mary and aren’t his brothers James, Joseph, Simon, and Judas?
And his sisters—don’t they all live around here? Just where did he get all this from?’”
And they got all bent out of shape about him. Jesus said to them,
He didn’t do a lot of miracles there because of their refusal to believe.
In that timeframe, Governor Herod got a report about Jesus.
He said to all those around him, “This is John the Baptist. He’s been raised from the dead, and that explains how he can work these miracles.”
You see, on account of Herodias, his brother Phillip’s wife, Herod arrested John, bound him, and put him away in jail.
This was because John kept on telling him, “It’s not lawful for you to be married to her.”
Though wanting to kill him, he feared the masses, because they considered him to be a prophet.
On Herod’s birthday, Herodias’s daughter performed a dance in front of everyone,
resulting in him making an oath promising that he’d give her anything she asked for.
Her mother nudged her to say, “Give me John the Baptist’s head on a platter.”
The king became deeply upset because of the oath that he made in front of all his guests. He ordered that the request be granted,
and he sent for John to be beheaded in jail.
His head was brought on a platter and was given to the teenage girl, and she presented it to her mother.
His disciples went there and took away his body, buried him, and went and told Jesus what had happened.
After Jesus heard about this, he left from there by boat to go some place out in the sticks to be alone. When the crowd heard, they followed him on foot from the cities.
He went out and saw the great crowd and felt a deep inner compassion for them and cured all those who weren’t well.

When it got late, his disciples came to him and said, “We’re out in the middle of nowhere, and it’s getting late. Dismiss the crowds so that they can venture out to the marketplaces in the surrounding towns and pick up something to eat.”
Jesus replied,
They then said, “We don’t have anything here except for five loaves of bread and two fishes.”
He said,
He had everyone in the crowd find a nice spot on the grass to relax. He took the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up in the sky, gave thanks, broke the bread and gave it to his disciples.
Everyone ate and ate until they were full. They took away the leftover pieces of bread and filled up twelve baskets with them.
Of those who had been fed, there were five thousand men, not including women and children.
Wasting no time, he urged his disciples to climb into a boat and go out ahead of him to the other side, while he, meanwhile, would dismiss the crowd.
After he dismissed the crowd, he went by himself up a mountain to pray. When evening arrived, he was up there alone.
The boat had already gotten more than a few miles away from shore, where it was being harassed by the waves, since there was a headwind.
Around four or five in the morning, he went towards them walking on the water.
When the disciples saw him walking on the water, they were startled and shouted, “There’s a ghost out there!”.
Immediately Jesus said to them,
So Peter replied, “Lord, if it’s you, order me to come to you on the water.”
Jesus said, “Come.” Peter got out of the boat and walked on water and went towards Jesus.
Seeing the strong wind, he got scared and started to sink and shouted, “Lord, help, save me!”
Immediately Jesus reached his hand out and got ahold of him and said,
After they got into the boat, the wind died down.
Those in the boat bowed down low in homage before him saying, “You really are God’s son.”
Having crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret.
The men from that area, recognizing him, sent the word out to the entire surrounding area, and they brought to him everyone who wasn’t well.
They were begging him, again and again, that they just be allowed to touch the edge of his shawl, and everybody who touched it became completely well.
Then some Pharisees and designated teachers from Jerusalem arrived saying,
”What’s the reason that your disciples disregard the rituals which have been handed down to us over the years, seeing that they don’t ceremonially wash their hands before eating?”
Jesus answered them,

Then his disciples went over to him and said, “Did you know that the Pharisees were offended by what you said?”

He didn’t say a word to her. His disciples went over to him and started saying, “Get rid of her.”
He replied to her, ”
So she came and prostrated herself in front of him and said, “Help me, sir.”
Jesus replied,
She said, “Yes, but also, sir: the dogs are fed by the scraps which their masters drop from their tables.”

Then this produced a response with Jesus; he said,
…And her daughter was healed that moment.
Returning from there Jesus went to the Sea of Galilee, and took a seat up in a hill that is alongside it.

A large crowd approached him, bringing with them their lame, blind, maimed, deaf & dumb, and many other such, and they laid them at his feet (i.e., they submitted them to his care), and he healed them,
to the degree that the crowd was awe-struck in seeing the deaf & dumb speak, the maimed become well, the lame walk, and the blind seeing. And they glorified the God of Israel.
Now Jesus summoned his disciples and said,
His disciples chimed in, “Where in the middle of nowhere can we get all the bread needed to fill up such a large crowd?”
Jesus continued and said, “How much bread do you have?” They said, “Seven loaves plus a little bit of fish.”
He told the crowd to find a nice spot on the ground to relax on.
He took the seven loaves and the fish, gave thanks, broke the bread, and gave it to his disciples.
All of them ate until they were stuffed. They gathered up the leftover scraps and filled up seven baskets with them.
There were four thousand men eating there that day—this doesn’t include women and children.
He dismissed the crowd, got into a boat, and went to the Magadan region.
The Pharisees and Sadducees came by. Testing him, they asked him to perform a spectacular miracle on the spot.
He delivered an answer to them,
… And he excused himself and departed.

Then they finally understood that he wasn’t telling them to beware of bread yeast but to beware of the Pharisees’ and Sadducees’ teaching.
Having arrived in the parts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples,
They replied, “Some, John the Baptist, others Elijah, still others Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
Simon Peter replied, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the Living God.”
Jesus came up with a reply and said to him,
Then he unequivocally ordered them not to tell anyone that he is the Messiah.

Starting then, Jesus began to go about showing his disciples that he must travel to Jerusalem in order to suffer greatly at the hands of the national councilmen, Chief Priests, and designated teachers, to be put to death, and to be resurrected on the third day.
Peter button-holed him and began to get on his case, “Oh, dear God! Lord! No way!”
Jesus snapped back at Peter,
Then Jesus said to his disciples,
Six days later, Jesus went up a high mountain, bringing along with him Peter, James, and his brother John—those four alone.
He was metamorphosed in front of them, and his face shined like the sun, and his clothing became as bright as the full light of day.
And—like that—Moses and Elijah were seen talking with him.
Peter exclaimed to Jesus, “Lord, it’s a good thing we’re here. If you’d like, I’ll build three little holy edifices to house them here, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.”

A cloud appeared abruptly while he was still in the middle of talking, engulfing them in its shadow, and just as abruptly a voice spoke from out of the cloud saying, “This here is my Beloved Son, in whom I’m quite pleased. Listen to him again and again.”
Once the disciples heard the voice, they fell flat on their faces and became really scared.
Jesus went to them, touched them, and said,
When they opened their eyes, they didn’t see anything except for Jesus back to normal and by himself again.
While they were going down the mountain, Jesus commanded them,
The disciples asked him, “So now, why do the designated teachers say that Elijah must come first, before everything else happens?”
He retorted,
It was then that the disciples understood that he was talking to them about John the Baptist.
When he got back to the crowd, a man came up to him kneeling in front of him
saying, “Sir, have pity on my son since he’s epileptic and suffers badly. You see, one moment he’s having a seizure and the next moment he’s back to normal again.
I brought him to your disciples, and they weren’t able to cure him.”
Jesus, in his reaction, answered,
Jesus dropped the hammer on him, the demon came out of him, and the child was treated that moment.
While they were alone, his disciples came over to him and asked, “What’s the reason why we couldn’t cast it out on our own?”
Engaging them, he said,

plus the quotation ‘…to love him from the entire heart and from the entire conscience and from the entire strength,’ plus the quotation ‘…to love a neighbor as yourself’ exceeds all burnt offerings and sacrifices.”
Jesus, seeing that he got it, replied, No one had the guts to ask him anything else any more.
After some thought, Jesus proceeded to speak, teaching in the temple,
The crowd, which was large, listened to him with delight.
He continued his teaching by saying to them,
He seated himself across from the collection basket, and watched and watched people, just what amount of money they were tossing into the basket; the rich people were tossing in great amounts.
This one widow came and tossed in a couple of dollars.
He called his disciples over and said,
While leaving the temple, one of his disciples then says, “Teacher, look—what breathtaking stones and edifices.”
Jesus said to him,
Sitting across from temple on the Mount of Olives alone with Peter, James, John, and Andrew,
they asked him confidentially, “When will these things take place, and what will be the sign indicating when the conclusion of all things is supposed to happen?”
Jesus began by saying to them,

Now in two days the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread was scheduled to start. The chief priests and the designated teachers were looking and looking for a way to use some sort of trickery to get ahold of him and kill him.
In this regard, they kept on saying, “Not in the midst of the festival, lest the people riot.”

While staying in Bethany, in Simon the leper’s house, while he was sitting at the dinner table, a woman with a jar of fragrant ointment—the pure, genuine expensive stuff—went up to him, cracked the jar open, and poured it all out on his head.
Now some of them who were there were furious, complaining amongst themselves, “What does her wasting of this ointment accomplish?
The fact is, this ointment here could’ve been sold for upwards of $30,000, and the proceeds donated to the poor.” They were fuming with indignation over her.
But Jesus said,
Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, left to meet up with the chief priests, in order for him to deliver Jesus into their custody.
When they heard the proposal, they were delighted and promised to give him a wad of cash. They began to look for an opportune moment to apprehend him.

On the first day of the Feast of Unleavened Bread, the day when they slaughtered the Passover sacrifice, his disciples, querying him, say, “Where do you want us to venture out to, to make the arrangements for you to partake of the Passover meal?”
He dispatched two of his disciples telling them,
The disciples departed and went into the city and found things to be just like he told them, and they made the Passover meal arrangements.
When it got to be late in the day, he arrived with the Twelve.
While they were dining and relaxing, Jesus said,
They became deeply upset, and they went on and on, one after another, telling him, “It’s not me.”
But he said,
While still eating, he took a loaf of bread, gave thanks, broke it, gave it to them, and said,
He took a cup, gave thanks, gave it to them,
and said,
After they sang some hymns, they left for the Mount of Olives.
Jesus then says to them,
Peter said to him, “Even if everyone else falls out, I won’t, uh-uh.”
Jesus said to him,
All the more vehemently he kept on saying, “Even if I have to die with you, I won’t deny you—no way!” The others, one after another, were saying the same thing.
They went to a place called Gethsemane, and he said to his disciples,
He took along with him Peter, James, and John and started to become gripped with agony and consternation.
He, in the midst of it, says,
He wandered out a bit and fell on the ground and began to pray and pray, praying if it’s possible that this hour pass him by.
In the midst of that he was saying,
He went and found them sleeping and then says to Peter,
Again, he went out and prayed the same prayer,
and again he found them sleeping; they didn’t know what they would say in response to him since their eyelids were sagging.
He came a third time and said to them,
Right away, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, showed up with a large party armed with swords and clubs sent from the chief priests, designated teachers, and councilmen.
His betrayer had set up a signal ahead of time, saying, “Whomever I greet with a kiss, seize him, secure him, and take him away.”
He went straight over to him and then says, “Teacher,” and kissed him cordially.
They laid their hands on him and grabbed ahold of him.
One of the men standing there with Jesus (and who was one of his associates, supporters, and defenders) unsheathed a sword, attacked the chief priest’s slave, and sliced off his ear.
Jesus considered what had happened and said to the party,
Everyone who was standing there with Jesus deserted him and began to flee.
A certain young man (a teenager) tagged along behind him, clothed only in a linen garment around his private parts. They grabbed him,
but he shed the garment they grabbed and ran away naked.
They took Jesus away to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the councilmen, and the designated teachers gathered together there.

Peter followed him from a distance, until he was within the courtyard of the chief priest’s domicile, and he took a seat alongside the attendants, warming himself up next to the fire used as the light source.
Now the chief priests and all the councilmen were trying to find someone to testify under oath against Jesus in order to sentence him to death, but they weren’t having any success finding anyone.
To that ends, many were saying phony things against him in court under oath, but the testimonies weren’t compelling.
Some of the ones taking the witness stand and testifying against him were saying,
”We personally heard him say, ‘I’ll tear down this man-made temple myself, and in three days I’ll build another one, one that’s not man-made’,”
but this testimony wasn’t adequate enough to produce a guilty verdict either.
The high priest stood up in front of everyone and, by means of inquiry, asked Jesus, “You don’t have anything to say in response to those who’ve testified against you?”
He kept silent and wouldn’t say anything in response. Again, the high priest asked him, “Are you the Messiah, the Christ, the Blessed Son?”,
and he said,
Then the high priest became unglued and in a rage starting breaking things, all the while saying, “What further testimony do we need?
You all heard the blasphemy; what’s it looking like to you?” So everyone there sentenced him to death.
Some of them began to go about spitting on him, blindfolding him, and striking him, saying to him, “Prophesy.” And then the attendants took him and slapped him around.
Being outside in the courtyard, Peter was approached by one of the high priest’s servant girls.
She saw Peter warming himself up, took a good hard look at him, and then says to him, “You too were with Jesus of Nazareth.”
He denied it, saying, “I have no first-hand knowledge or understanding of what you’re saying,” and he left the courtyard to go out to the porch. A rooster crowed.
While looking at him, the servant girl began talking to the bystanders again, “This guy’s one of them.”
He denied it again. Again, a bit later, the bystanders were saying to Peter, “Seriously—you’re one of them, since you’re a Galilean.”
He began to cuss repeatedly and to swear by oaths, “I don’t know this person, whomever it is that you’re talking about.”

Immediately a rooster crowed a second time. Peter remembered the statement which Jesus made, that before a rooster crows twice, you will have denied me three times. It hit him like a ton of bricks, and he started crying.

Without delay, late in the night the chief priests, along with all the councilmen and the designated teachers, convened a meeting, bound Jesus, carried him away, and delivered him into Pilate’s custody.
Pilate asked him, “You’re the king of the Jews?” He answered him, “Whatever you say.”
The chief priests accused him of many things.
Again, Pilate asked him, “You’re not going to say anything in response? Take a look at how many accusations they’ve leveled against you.”
But to Pilate’s astonishment, Jesus didn’t have anything more to say.
He had an ongoing tradition, done at each festival, of releasing one prisoner for them, whomever they’d ask for.
There was one called Barabbas who had been imprisoned along with the revolutionaries, in particular those who had committed murder during the insurrection.
The crowd came over and initiated making the request, in accordance with his usual practice.
Pilate responded to them, “Do you want me to set the king of the Jews free?”,
since he was aware that the chief priests had him arrested out of envy.
Now, the chief priests had whipped the crowd into a frenzy, in order that their preference would be to release Barabbas.
Again, Pilate responded to them, “So now, what do you want me to do with the one who’s called the King of the Jews?”
Again, they shouted, “Crucify him!”
Pilate said to them multiple times, “…Because he’s done what wrong?” But they shouted all the more, “Crucify him!”
Intending to placate the crowd, Pilate set Barabbas free and handed over Jesus, after he had him flogged, to be crucified.
The soldiers led him away to a courtyard inside the compound, the one used by the governor’s security guards, and called over the entire company of guards.
They clothed him in a robe a nobleman would wear and placed on him a crown, a wreath woven from thorns.
They began to go about greeting him, “Pleased to meet you King of the Jews.”
They kept on hitting him on the head with a rod, spitting on him, and getting on their knees in an act of subservience to him.
When they finished ridiculing him, they took the robe off and put his clothes back on him, and they led him away to be crucified.
They pressed into service a random passerby, Simon of Cyrene (the one who’s the father of Alexander and Rufus), who happened to be coming in from working out in the fields, to carry his cross.
They brought him up on top of the place called Golgotha, which translated means “Skull Place.”
They kept on trying to give him spiced wine, but he wouldn’t take it.
They crucified him and divvied up his clothing, rolling dice to see who was going to get to take it away.
Now it was mid-morning when they performed the crucifixion on him.
There was a sign stating the reason why he was crucified, and it read, “The king of the Jews.”
They crucified two thugs with him, together as a group, one to the left of him and one to the right of him.
Those who passed by reviled him, nodding their heads left and right saying, “Ah! The one who’ll supposedly destroy the temple and rebuild it in three days—
Save yourself: come down off that cross.”

In the same way, the chief priests and the designated teachers, going back and forth with each other making fun of him, in the midst of that were saying, “He went and rescued others, but he cannot save himself.
The Messiah, the Christ, the King of Israel: let him come down from the cross now, so that we would see and believe.” Even his fellow crucifixion-mates kept on taunting him.
When it got to be noon, darkness appeared over the entire planet until late afternoon,
and in the late afternoon, Jesus shouted in a loud voice, , which is translated,
Some of the bystanders heard this and started saying, “Look, he’s calling on Elijah.”

Someone ran and soaked a sponge in a mixture of water and vinegar that the soldiers commonly drank, put it on a rod, and proceeded to offer it to him to drink, saying, “Let’s see if Elijah comes and takes him down from off the cross,”
but Jesus let out a great cry and passed away,
and the temple curtain was torn in two from top to bottom.
Seeing this, the army captain standing across from him said, “This man really was the embodiment of a son of God.”
Now there were also women watching at a distance, among whom were Mary Magdalene, Mary mother of James the younger and of Joses, and Salome,
those women who were ever his followers and were constantly attending to his needs when he was in Galilee, and many other women who accompanied him to Jerusalem.
It had gotten to be late, and since it was a preparatory day (that is, a pre-feast day or pre-Sabbath preparatory day),
Joseph of Arimathea, an influential councilman, who also was himself a true believer, got up the courage, entered Pilate’s compound, and went up to Pilate and asked for Jesus’s body.
But Pilate wondered if he had in fact died already, and summoned the captain and asked him if it had been a while since he died.
Getting up to speed with the captain, he presented the body to Joseph as a gift,

and Joseph purchased a cloth sheet made of linen and used for wrapping, took him down, rolled him up in the sheet, put him in a tomb, one which had been hewn out of a rock formation, and rolled a stone over the tomb’s entrance.
Now Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses were monitoring where he was being placed.
After sundown, just after the Sabbath restrictions came to a close, Mary Magdalene, Mary mother of James, and Salome bought fragrant spices in order to go and apply to his body, covering it all over.
Very early on Sunday morning, when the sun had just risen, they went to the tomb.
They were repeatedly saying amongst themselves, “Who’s going to roll the stone back away from the entrance of the tomb?”,
and they all at once looked up and observed that the stone had been rolled away (it was simply enormous, you see).
They came to the tomb and saw a man who looked to be in his late teens or early twenties sitting off to the right wearing a long white robe, and they were startled out of their wits.
But he then tells them, “Don’t be startled. Jesus of Nazareth who had been crucified has been resurrected; he’s not here—take a look at the place where they put him.
In any event, go your way and tell his disciples—and Peter—that he’s heading out before them to Galilee. They’ll see him there, just like he told them they would.”
They exited the tomb and began to run away like mad, since they were in a state of shock and were shaking all over. They didn’t say anything to anyone, since they were still too terrified to do so.
After he had been resurrected early Sunday morning, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, whom he had cast out seven demons out of.
That lady went and told the news to those who had been mourning and weeping with her,
and those who heard that he’s alive and that he had been seen by her refused to believe it.
Now after these appearances, he appeared in a different form to two of them while they were going out to the countryside,
and those very people went away and told everyone else—they didn’t believe those people either.

Now last of all he appeared to the Eleven while they were relaxing taking a meal, and he chewed them out for their refusal to believe and for their hardness of heart, because they didn’t believe those who had beheld him resurrected.
He said to them,
So then the Lord Jesus, after speaking to them, was taken up into the sky and assumed his position as God’s chief executive.

But those very disciples went out and preached everywhere, the Lord working alongside and cooperating with them like a fellow-worker, and the message kept on being confirmed, established, and made certain by means of the supernatural signs following happening right there on the spot, right on their heels.
In light of the fact that many have attempted to compose a narrative concerning the deeds which have been carried out to fulfillment among us,
and to record it in the same way that they—those from the get-go who became eye-witnesses and custodians of the entire affair—delivered and entrusted it to us,

it seemed like a good idea for me to follow up after them and write something for you, something that starts from the very beginning and which is completely accurate and in sequential order, Lord Theophilus,
so that you would become thoroughly acquainted with the affairs which you’ve learned by word of mouth, and that you would know them with certainty.

It came to pass in the days of Herod, king of the Jews, that there was a certain priest named Zechariah, from the Order of Abijah, and he had a wife who was of the priestly caste—and her name was Elizabeth.
Both of them were righteous in the sight of God, their conduct, from God’s perspective, was that they complied with all the commandments and expectations of correct behavior.
They had no children, because Elizabeth couldn’t have any children, and both were now elderly.
Now during his priestly order’s timeslot in the rotation schedule, he happened to be the one performing the priestly duties in the holy presence of God
(the appointment being determined according to the priests’ tradition of rolling dice), having entered into the temple sanctuary itself to light the incense;
and everyone who was in the multitude, a multitude of the folk-people, was outside praying during the hour of the incense lighting ritual.
So now, an angel sent from the Lord appeared to him standing to the right of the Altar of Incense.
Looking at the angel, Zechariah became disturbed, and fear fell upon him.
The angel said to him, “Don’t be afraid, Zechariah; you see, your prayer has been taken to heart, and your wife Elizabeth shall bear you a son, and you’ll name him John.
He’ll be a cause of joy and exultation for you, and many will rejoice at his birth.
Indeed, he’ll be used mightily by the Lord and won’t drink wine or liquor—absolutely won’t—and he’ll be filled with the Holy Spirit while still in his mother’s womb,
and many native Israelites will heed the Lord their God.

The Lord will use him as a herald in a spirit and power the likeness of which Elijah had, to soften the hearts of the fathers towards the children, and the skeptics and the disobedient to the sensibility of the ways of the righteous, to bring about a fully-refined people for the Lord.”
Zechariah said to the angel, “Just how will the realization of these things come to me? The fact is, I’m old, and my wife is well-past her prime.”
The angel replied, “I am the high-ranking angel Gabriel: the one who stands in the presence of God. Concerning these things, He sent me to speak to you and deliver the good news.

See here now—you will remain silent, unable to speak, until the time comes that these things come to pass, as a consequence of you not having believed my words, which will be fulfilled in the course of good time.”
The people were expecting Zechariah to have come out already and were baffled at how long a time he was spending in the temple.
When he came out, he was unable to speak to them, and they realized that he’d seen a vision while inside the temple. He was gesturing to them, all the while remaining mute.
When his order’s timeslot for priestly service was up, he left to go back home.
Some time afterwards, his wife Elizabeth conceived, and during the five months that she was keeping herself in seclusion, she kept on saying,
”All this because the Lord wanted things to turn out for me in a way that would remove my shame in the eyes of others.”
Now in the sixth month of Elizabeth’s pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to a city in Galilee called Nazareth,
to a young, never-married woman engaged to a man named Joseph, who was a direct descendant of David—and the name of this young woman was Mary.
He entered the physical world right in front of her and said, “Greetings, favored-one, the Lord be with you.”
Now she was deeply disturbed at the remark and was trying to figure out what the nature of the visit would be.
The angel said to her, “Don’t be afraid, Mary; the fact is, you’ve found favor with God.
See here now—you’ll conceive and give birth to a son, and you’ll name him ‘Jesus.’
He’ll be capable, noteworthy, and accomplished and will be called a son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his ancestor David,
and he’ll reign forever over the Israeli people, and his kingdom will never come to an end.”
Mary said to the angel, “How will this come about, since I don’t have a husband with whom to be intimate?”

The angel answered, “The Holy Spirit will come over you, and the miraculous power of the Most High will engulf you. For this reason, the one you’re giving birth to is holy, and he’ll be called a son of God.
Take a look—in her old age, your relative Elizabeth—even she—is pregnant with a son; the one everyone took for granted was infertile—this is her sixth month of pregnancy.
You see, with God, all things are possible.”
Mary said, “I present myself as the servant of the Lord. Let things come to pass with regard to me according to your word.” And the angel departed from her.
During this time, Mary took a trip into the hill country, to a town in Judea.
She entered Zechariah’s house and was welcomed enthusiastically by Elizabeth.
It so happened that when Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the baby leaped in her womb; Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,

and with a great cry uttered back, “You in particular among women be blessed, (that is, the recipient of good things); and blessed be, (that is, let the pronouncement of goodness be over), the produce of your womb.
How did I get such an honor, that the mother of my Lord would come to visit me?
In fact—get this—the moment the sound of your greeting entered my ear, the baby I’m carrying leaped in exultation.
She who believed is blessed, because it will be a realization of those things which have been spoken to her and established from the Lord.”
And Mary said,
”My life-being extols the Lord And my spirit has heaped exultation upon God my Savior
Because He took interest in the abasement of his slave. Yes indeed—and—hey—from now onAll generations will call me blessed
Because he has done great things for me, the Capable One, And holy is His name,
And His mercy is directed towards those Who have a deep reverence for Him.For generation upon generation
The One exuding power intervened In the affairs of man and did this:He routed those who are high-and-mightyWhere the intention of their heart is concerned.
He pulled down rulers from their thrones And exalted the abased.
From out of good things He filled the hungry up, And He punted the rich,Sending them away empty-handed.
He took the responsibility of caring for Israel, his child, To take heed and remember mercy,
In accordance to what he said to our ancestors, To Abraham and to his descendants until the end of time.”
Mary remained with her for three months and set out for the return trip back home.
Now Elizabeth’s due-date arrived, and she gave birth to a son.
Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord showered tremendous mercy on her and rejoiced with her joy and congratulated her.
When the eighth day after birth came, they went to circumcise the child, and they were thinking of naming him after his father Zechariah.
His mother spoke up and said, “No—he’ll be named John instead.”
They told her, “You don’t have any relatives who go by that name.”
They started gesturing to his father what he might possibly want to name him.
He asked for a chalkboard and wrote, “His name will be John.” Everyone was taken back:
he immediately regained his ability to talk, and he began speaking, uttering praises to God.
A deep reverence came over all his neighbors, and the whole hill country of Judea kept on talking about all these matters;
the reports settled deep in the heart of everyone who heard them: they were saying, “What will come of this child as a result?” The fact is, God was directing the course of his life.
Zechariah, his father, was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied,
Blessed is the Lord God of Israel, Because He showed up and did a spiritual service for His people
And got a horn ready, a horn Which signals security and the end to our misery,Ready to blow, to be a cue for usBy means of the lineage of David, His son
In accordance to what He spoke Through the mouth of the holy people who lived long agoProphesying about him from the beginning of time:
”Security and the end to our misery from our enemies And from the ability of those who hate us to do us harm:
To perform an act of mercy in the company of our ancestors And to remember His holy covenant,
An oath which He swore to our ancestor Abraham:
The promise to grant us bold raid-and-rescue operations To get us out from the clutches of our enemies;To be continuously holding worship services dedicated to Him
In piety, holiness, and correctness In His midst for all the days of our lives.”
Now you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High You see, you’re destined to be a trailblazer for the LordTo prepare the road that he’ll take
To impart to his people The comprehension of their security and of an end to their miseryBy means of the forgiveness of their sins
Through deep, heartfelt mercies from our God, By which mercies a sunrise to noon-like epoch will come visit us,
To shine upon those in darkness, Upon those sitting under a death-shadow,To put us on the path to peace.
The child grew and grew and became stronger and stronger in spirit, and he stayed out in the wilderness until the time came for his public appearance to the nation of Israel.
Around that time, an edict from Caesar Augustus was issued to the entire civilized world.
This edict was a census, and this census was the first one issued during the tenure of Quirinius, the ruler of the Roman province of Syria.
Everyone was either coming or going to be registered, each to the city he belonged to.
So Joseph went from the city of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David, which is called “Bethlehem,” on account of him being of the lineage of and being a descendant of David,
to be registered for the census along with his fiancée Mary, who was expecting.
While they were there, her due-date arrived,
and she gave birth to a son, her firstborn, wrapped him in a blanket, and laid him in a manger, since there wasn’t any room for them in the upstairs floor of the house they were at.
Nearby in the same area, there were shepherds working the night shift outdoors, keeping an eye on their sheep.
An angel sent from the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shined all around them, and they became very frightened.
The angel said to them, “Don’t be afraid, since I’m here, you see, to announce to you something good, a message about the tremendous grace which will be given to all the people,
since this day a savior, who is Christ the Lord, was born in your midst in the city of David.
This is the way you’ll spot him: you’ll find a baby all wrapped up lying in a manger.”
And suddenly a multitude of troops from the angels in heaven appeared together with the angel praising God, saying over and over,
Glory to God to the max, And peace be upon the Earth among men of good intent

When the angels departed from them back to heaven, the shepherds began saying to one another, “Let’s go from one end of Bethlehem to the other, right this moment, until we get to look into this situation, this thing that the Lord informed us of.”
They left in a hurry and discovered it: Mary, Joseph, and the baby lying in the manger.
While looking things over, they made known the details of the message spoken to them in regard to this very child.
Many of those who had heard what was said were amazed at what the shepherds were telling them;
Mary latched on to all these words while they were being deposited into her heart and collected there.
The shepherds returned glorifying and praising God for everything they heard about and saw, which was in fact just like it had been spoken to them.
When the eighth day, the day for him to be circumcised, rolled around, they named him “Jesus,” the name given by the angel before he was conceived.
And when the purification time, the span of time in accordance with the Old Testament statute, had expired, they took him over to Jerusalem to be presented to the Lord,
just as it’s written in the Old Testament, “Every man-child who is a mother’s first delivery shall be designated as set aside for the Lord,”
and to offer up a sacrifice according to the commandment in the Old Testament, “a pair of turtledoves or two young doves.”
Now, you see, there was a man in Jerusalem named Simeon, and this fellow was righteous and devout, awaiting Israel’s consolation, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
He had been informed in a consultation by the Holy Spirit that he won’t encounter death before seeing Christ the Lord.
By the Spirit, he went to the temple and to the parents as they were presenting the child Jesus, carrying out the Old Testament ritual concerning him,
and he himself took him into his arms, gave a blessing to God, and said,
”At this time You’re releasing Your servant From his service in peace, Master,Just like You said you would,
Because my eyes have seen Your rescue program,
That which You’ve prepared in accordance with The disposition of the people:
A light resulting in a revelation for the nations And resulting in your people Israel’s high regard.”
His father and mother were surprised by what was spoken about him.
Simeon pronounced a blessing on them and said to Mary, “You see, this fellow is destined to be the cause of the downfall and rejuvenation of many in Israel and to be a portent spoken against them.
And for you—your very life-being will be gone through with a sword, pierced from end to end, so that from out of many hearts, contemplations and reasonings would be revealed.”
There was a prophetess named Anna, daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was up there in years, having married as a young woman, her marriage lasting for seven years,
and after that being a widow for 84 years, during which time she hadn’t been absent from the temple, fasting and praying day and night in service to God.

At the same time the ritual was going on, she went over and stood by their side, all the while professing affirmations in acknowledgement to God and speaking about Him to all those in Jerusalem awaiting the rectification of their dire straits.
When all the rituals prescribed by the Old Testament were concluded, they left for Galilee, to their hometown of Nazareth.
Now the child kept on growing and kept on getting stronger, while being filled with wisdom, and God’s favor was upon him.
Year after year, his parents kept going back to Jerusalem, to the Passover festival,
and when he was twelve years old, they went to Jerusalem according to festival custom.
When the festival, which lasted a few days, was over, as they were departing, the child Jesus remained in Jerusalem, but his parents were unaware.
Having assumed that he was somewhere in the caravan, they were on the road a few days and began searching for him among their relatives and acquaintances,
but they weren’t able to find him. They returned to Jerusalem in search of him.
It so happened that after three days they found him in the temple sitting in the middle of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
All of those who were listening to him were amazed at his understanding—his ability to put things together—and at his answers.
Upon seeing this, his parents were taken aback, and his mother said to him, “Child, why have you treated us this way? Look—your father and I have been pulling our hair out looking for you.”
He said to them, “Just why now were you searching for me? Didn’t you know that I had to be in the midst of my Father’s interests?”
They didn’t put all the pieces together from the remark that was spoken to them.
He left with them and went to Nazareth, and he was staying in submission to their authority. His mother in her heart latched on to all these incidences, one after another;
and Jesus continued forging ahead in wisdom, stature, and in God’s and in peoples’ favor.

In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, while Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod the ruler in Galilee (his brother Philip, though, was the ruler of the regions Iturea and Traconitis, and Lysanias the ruler of Abiline),
during the tenure of the high priests Annas and Caiaphas, the word of the Lord (i.e. a prophetic message) came to John son of Zechariah while in the countryside.

He went into all the surrounding regions of the Jordan preaching a baptism—a water immersion-type of initiation ceremony—signifying a total commitment to a change in conduct to live the right way and initiating into a forgiveness of sins.,
as it’s been written in the Book of Isaiah, the prophet: The sound of shouting in the countryside:“Block off the road the Lord will take!Barricade the streets he’ll be on!”
Every living being will witness God’s rescue program.”
Accordingly, he went on and on saying to the crowd coming out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who convinced you to run for your lives because of the coming wrath?

up until the day he was taken up into heaven, having left orders with the apostles through the Holy Spirit—apostles whom he had personally hand-picked.
After his suffering, he also appeared to them alive using many demonstrations and proofs, making himself visible to them over the course of forty days and discussing matters related to God’s kingdom.
While they were assembled, he commanded them not to leave Jerusalem for a while, but instead to wait for the Father’s promise (quoting Jesus),
Indeed now—when they were gathered together, they kept asking him over and over, “Lord, is this the moment in time you’re going to reinstate Israel as its own sovereign nation?”
He told them,
After he said these things, while they were still looking at him he was taken up: a cloud took him away out of their sight.
As they were staring up into the sky while he was travelling upwards, two men dressed in white appeared out of nowhere and stood next to them,

and they said, “Gentlemen, fellow Galileans, why are you just standing there looking up into the sky? This Jesus who was taken away from you up into the sky will come in the same manner which you’ve observed him travelling into the sky.”
They then returned to Jerusalem from what’s known as the Mount of Olives, which is near Jerusalem, about a half-mile/1 km down the road.

When they entered the city, they went to the top floor of where they were staying, they being Peter, John, James, Andrew, Philip, Thomas, Bartholomew, Matthew, James son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas son of James.
All of these fellows were in one accord and single-mindedly sticking to it—not getting side-tracked—in prayer, accompanied by women and by Mary the mother of Jesus and his brothers.

During the span of time they were up there, Peter stood up in the midst of the comrades (and there was a group consisting of 120 grown men, the figure not including the women, teens, and children) and said,

”Gentlemen, fellow comrades, the verses in the Bible had to be fulfilled which the Holy Spirit spoke beforehand through David’s mouth about Judas, who became ringleader to those who apprehended Jesus,
that he was considered to be one of us and that he wound up being the unfortunate one who performed this duty.”

To recap, that guy used some or all of the payment he received for his wrong-doing and acquired a plot of property with it, and got himself in a head-first direction and killed himself in such a way that his torso ruptured and all of his intestines spilled out.
This became known to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, resulting in that plot of land being called Akeldama in their language, which is translated “Plot of Blood,”

Returning to what Peter said, ”Seeing that the Book of Psalms has recorded in it, “Let his domicile go from occupied to unoccupied,And from there on out Let there be no one who occupies it“And,“Let someone else assume his leadership position
”So it has to be one of the men who accompanied us the entire time that the Lord Jesus was acquainted with us,
starting from John’s baptism up until the day which he was taken from us (namely that he was a witness of his resurrection), in order for one of these men to become one of us.”
Two candidates were put forward, Joseph who’s called Barsabbas, who’s also known as Justus, and Matthias.
They prayed and said, “You, Lord, are intimately familiar with the hearts of everyone; point out the one you’ve selected from among these two
to assume the position of this ministry and apostleship, which Judas usurped for his own purpose.”
They flipped a coin, and Matthias won the toss, and he was henceforth considered to be an apostle along with the eleven others.
When all the days had been checked off until fifty were reached—the Day of Pentecost—everyone was together and on the same page.
From out of the sky a noise suddenly occurred, one which seemed like a violent wind was being swept in, and it filled the entire building in which they were sitting.
Tongues like the tongues of the flames from a fire were seen being distributed to them, and a tongue sat upon each and every one of them,
and every one of them was filled with the Holy Spirit and began to speak in various tongues (other languages) as the Spirit kept on giving them the unction to be uttering in tongues.
Now there were Jews staying in Jerusalem, devout men, who were from every nation across the globe.
So when this sound happened, a bunch of them, confused, gathered together, because each person kept hearing them speaking in his own dialect of his own language.
They were non-stop confused and kept on wondering saying, “Don’t look now—but aren’t all of these folks who are speaking Galileans?
And how is it that each of us can hear what’s being spoken in his own native dialect of his own native language?—
Parthians, Medes, Elamites; those who live in Mesopotamia, Judea and not only there but in Cappadocia, Pontus, the province of Asia,
Phrygia, and not only there but Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya around Cyrene; visitors from Rome,
both Jews and Gentiles who’ve converted to Judaism; Cretans and Arabs—we all hear them in our own languages saying things which magnify God.”
Now everyone kept on being amazed, confused and perplexed, telling one another, “What in the world’s going on?”
But others, jeering, kept on saying something to the effect, “They went off and got drunk on sweet wine, the stuff the winos are always drinking.”

Peter along with the eleven others stood to address the crowd, raised his voice, and announced, “Men, Judeans, and everyone who’s staying in Jerusalem: may you listen to what I have to say and may this become understood to you.
The fact of the matter is, it’s not what you think, that is that these people are drinking, seeing that it’s only nine in the morning,
but instead this is what’s spoken through the prophet Joel,

”’In the Last Days, things will turn out this way,’ God says:‘I’ll pour out My Spirit onto all flesh.Your sons and daughters will prophesy,Your young men will see visions,Your elderly men will dream dreams.
In those days I will pour out My Spirit Upon My male and female servants—Indeed I will—And they will prophesy.
I will grant that wonders occur in the sky above And signs upon the earth below:Blood, fire, and smoke trails.
The sun will change into darkness And the moon into bloodPrior to the comingOf the Great and Marvelous Day of the Lord.
And things will turn out this way: All who choose to call for the Lord to act on his behalfIn the way He is reputed to actWill be spared calamity.’

”Men, Israelites, listen to what I’m telling you. Jesus of Nazareth was a man who had been appointed by God to act on our behalf, and God performed miracles, wonders, and signs for us through him in your midst, as you all know.

By the specific determination of God, one which He decided ahead of time, this man was apprehended and taken into custody by bad, out-of-control men, fastened to a cross, and the cross was hoisted up as a form of execution.
God resurrected this man, having broken the travail of death, on account of the fact that it wasn’t possible for him to be overpowered and constrained by death,

seeing that in the Scriptures David told him, “Throughout it all, I kept on seeing the Lord ahead of timeIn the area that I was most concerned aboutBecause He is right where I need HimSo that I don’t get rattled.
Because of this, I rejoiced in heart and uttered exultations, And, what’s more, my physical well-beingWill occupy the spot where hope exists,
Because You have not left the essence of my life-being In the graveyard,Nor will You allow your Holy One to undergo decay.
Having familiarized me with the way of life, You will fill me with gladnessWith Your undivided attention.

”Men, comrades, it’s appropriate to address you with confidence concerning our patriarch David, to say that he too passed away and was buried, and that his tomb has been right nearby from the day he died up until the present time.
So being a prophet and knowing that God made an oath and ‘swore to him that from out of the collection of those whom he would sire and their offspring, one of them would sit on his throne,’
while seeing into the future, he spoke about the resurrection of Jesus; the fact is, “He has neither been left to the graveyard,Nor has his flesh undergone decay
”God resurrected this Jesus-fellow, of which we all are witnesses,

and thereupon promoted him to the position of God’s Chief Executive—not only that but having received the promise of the Holy Spirit from the Father, he’s poured out all of this that you see and hear.
You see, David didn’t ascend into heaven, but it was he specifically who said, “The Lord said to my Lord,‘Assume the role of being My right-hand man
Until such time I choose To subjugate your enemies in obeisance to you’
”Let it be known with certainty to the entire Israeli ethnicity-nation that God made him both Lord and Messiah (Christ), this Jesus-fellow whom you crucified.”
Now, after they heard this, it caused their hearts to melt, and they told Peter and the rest of the apostles, “What should we do about it, men, comrades?”

Peter told them, “Have a change of heart and of ways and go ahead and have each of you be baptized by the authority of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of your sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

You see, the promise is for you, for your children and for everyone who’s far away—it is just as much given to the one as to the other; in other words, it is for all those whom the Lord God happens to or chooses to summon.”
He kept on stating a lot of other declarations, and kept on appealing to them summarized by saying, “May you escape from this twisted contemporary Zeitgeist.”
So those who took to heart and acted upon his message were baptized, and on that day around three-thousand individuals were added.
They were faithful to keep listening to the apostles’ instruction, to keep having fellowship-dinners together, dinners culminating in a communion memorial, and to keep attending the prayer meetings.
Now a deep reverence was continually maintained, and many signs and wonders kept on occurring through the apostles.
Now all of those believing were on the same page in regard to the previously mentioned things and shared everything,
and properties and possessions kept on being sold, and that which was sold kept on being distributed to every person according to whoever happened to have a need.

Not only that but day by day they continued to be faithful to be in one accord in the temple, and furthermore they continued to attend the dinners mentioned previously from house to house, sharing food with great joy and simplicity of heart,
praising God and having favor with the entirety of the folk-people—and the Lord kept adding those being saved day by day while the previously mentioned things were going on.
Now Peter and John went over to the temple at the Three-in-the-Afternoon-Prayer-Time,

and a certain man who was lame from the time he was born, having to be carried around all time, was there, whom some people day after day kept on placing at the temple gate known as the Beautiful Gate, so that he could beg for handouts from those entering the temple complex.
Seeing that Peter and John were about to go into the temple complex, he asked for a handout.
Peter stared at him, and John joined in with him, and Peter said, “Look at us!”
He proceeded to give heed to them, looking at them and paying attention to them, waiting to—expecting to—get something from them.
Peter said, “I don’t have any cash on me, but I’ll give you what I’ve got: by the authority vested in me by Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk around!”—
And he grabbed him by his right hand and pulled him up—And immediately his feet and ankles were strengthened and made sturdy—
And with a leap he stood up and started walking around and entered the temple complex together with them, walking around, jumping, and praising God.
All the folk-people saw him walking around and praising God,

and they recognized him as the same beggar who used to sit where the beggars sit at the temple’s Beautiful Gate, and they were filled with amazement and exhilaration at how things had turned out for him.
While the lame man was clutching Peter and John, folks everywhere at the colonnade known as Solomon’s Colonnade ran towards them, utterly amazed.
Seeing this, Peter responded to the crowd, “Men, Israelites, why are you amazed at this? Why are you staring at us as though we enabled him to walk by our own power or piety?

The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob—the God of our patriarchal ancestors—glorified His servant Jesus, whom you all had arrested and whom you all rejected in the very presence of Pilate, after that guy delivered a verdict that would have set him free.
You rejected the holy and righteous one and asked for a homicidal man—a murderer—to be let off the hook and given back to you.
You killed the Prince of Life, whom God raised from the dead, of which we are witnesses.

And based on the faith which is derived from Jesus’s authorization to act, this person whom you see and know first-hand—Jesus’s authorization to act strengthened him and made him sturdy, and right in front of you all, the through-him-faith gave him this perfect health which you see.
Yes indeed comrades, I know that you conducted your lives in a way which is consistent with ignorance, just like your predecessors and ancestors did,
but the God that made the suffering of His Messiah known ahead of time through the mouth of all the prophets caused these things be fulfilled in this manner.
”So now, have a change of ways and turn your hearts to the obliteration of your sins,
in order that episodes of refreshing would issue forth from the Lord’s totally-focused attention, and He would send you the one who’s already been appointed to a position of authority, Christ Jesus,
whom the spiritual world will most definitely embrace up to the times of the establishment of everything that God has spoken through the mouth of His saints—namely the prophets—from day-one.

Yes, in the Old Testament Moses said that, “The Lord our God will bring to prominence a prophetAnd send him your way,A prophet from among our fellow men—One who is like me.You shall listen to what comes out of himAnd you shall act in accordance to everythingThat he happens to say to you.
What will happen to any individual Who chooses not to listen to that prophetIs that he will be absolutely annihilated,Never seen or heard from again.
”Indeed, all the prophets starting with Samuel, including those who came afterwards, talked about and announced these days that we’re living in.

You all are the beneficiaries of the prophets and of the covenant which God entered into with our ancestors, saying to Abraham, ‘All of the nationalities of the earth will be blessed by one of your descendants.’
God first and foremost brought to prominence his servant and sent him your way blessing you when each person turns away from your evil ways.”
While they were talking to the folk-people, the priests, the temple guards, and the Sadducees showed up,
exasperated because of them teaching the people and proclaiming Jesus’s resurrection from the dead,
and they arrested them and put them in jail until the next day; you see, it was evening already.
Many of those who heard the message became believers, and the number of men (not including women and children) who believe in Jesus reached five thousand.
Now what happened the next day is that the rulers, the councilmen, and the designated teachers convened in Jerusalem—
and Annas the High Priest was among them, and Caiaphas, John, and Alexander, and any person at all who was born into and, as a result, belonged to the high priests’ caste.
They made them stand in the center for questioning, “By what governmental power have you done this, or who authorized you to do this in their agency?”
Then Peter, filled with the Holy Spirit, told them, “Rulers of the people and councilmen:
If we’re being questioned in court today in reference to a good deed done to a feeble man, namely as to just how exactly this fellow has been pulled out of his miserable condition:
